alert.note: Alert for Calabasas and Agoura Hills; Central Ventura County Valleys; Eastern San Fernando Valley; Eastern Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley; Northern Ventura County Mountains; Santa Clarita Valley; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Western San Fernando Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 27 at 2:15PM PDT until October 30 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH 10 PM MONDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MUCH OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES... .Our first significant Santa Ana wind event of the season will likely bring critical Red Flag conditions to wind prone areas of Los Angeles and Ventura counties late Saturday night into Monday evening. The onset of Santa Ana winds will bring rapid drying to the region late Saturday night, with widespread single digit humidities Sunday into Monday. The strongest Santa Ana winds are expected Sunday, when gusts of 35 to 50 mph will be common, except gusts of 50 to 65 mph likely in the Los Angeles county mountains, Santa Susana mountains, western Santa Monicas, and wind prone foothills. Dry and breezy offshore flow conditions will persist into Tuesday which may extend critical fire weather conditions across portions of Los Angeles and Ventura counties. While not currently in the warning area, interior portions of San Luis Obispo and Santa Barbara counties will see elevated to brief critical fire weather conditions Sunday into Monday. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM SUNDAY TO 10 PM PDT MONDAY FOR GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR VALLEYS OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES AS WELL AS THE VENTURA COUNTY MOUNTAINS AND EASTERN SANTA MONICAS... The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard has issued a Red Flag Warning FOR GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, which is in effect from 3 AM Sunday to 10 PM PDT Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Winds...North to northeast 20 to 35 mph with gusts 40 to 50 mph, except isolated gusts to 60 mph in favored foothills. Strongest winds on Sunday, diminishing around 10 mph on Monday. * Relative Humidity...Minimum humidity each day 5 to 10 percent. Very poor humidity recoveries of 10 to 20 percent in wind prone areas. * Impacts...If fire ignition occurs there could be rapid spread of wildfire that would lead to a threat to life and property.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. Use extreme caution with anything that can spark a wildfire. Residents near wildland interfaces should be prepared to evacuate if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information.
